content.description:
A BEREAVED MILITARY FAMILY, PAINTING BY JAPANESE ARTIST NOBORU MATSUI, 1898

Image courtesy of the Museum of the Imperial Collections (Sannomaru Shozokan), Tokyo

The painting shows a Japanese mother and her children receiving news that their husband/father has died fighting in an overseas war. The husband’s/father’s uniform and sword are lying on the floor.
content.question: In addition to Japan, which of the following non-European states created an empire in the Asia-Pacific region in the late nineteenth century?

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
